1.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.text: He hath led me, and brought me into darkness, but not into light.

3.text: Surely against me is he turned; he turneth his hand against me all the day.

4.text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

5.text: He hath built against me, and compassed me with gall and labor.

6.text: He hath set me in dark places, as they that are dead of old.

7.text: He hath hedged me about, that I cannot get out: he hath made my chain heavy.

8.text: Also when I cry and shout, he shutteth out my prayer.

9.text: He hath inclosed my ways with hewn stone, he hath made my paths crooked.

10.text: He was to me as a bear lying in wait, and as a lion in secret places.

11.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces: he hath made me desolate.

12.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He hath caused the arrows of his quiver to enter into my reins.

14.text: I was a derision to all my people; and their song all the day.

15.text: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath made me drunken with wormwood.

16.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones, he hath covered me with ashes.

17.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace: I forgat prosperity.

18.text: And I said, My strength and my hope hath perished from the LORD:

19.text: Remembering my affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

20.text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is humbled in me.

21.text: This I recall to my mind, therefore have I hope.

22.text: It is of the LORDâ€™S mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

23.text: They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.

24.text: The LORD is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

25.text: The LORD is good to them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

26.text: It is good that a man should both hope and quietly wait for the salvation of the LORD.

27.text: It is good for a man that he should bear the yoke in his youth.

28.text: He sitteth alone, and keepeth silence, because he hath borne it upon him.

29.text: He putteth his mouth in the dust; if there may be hope.

30.text: He giveth his cheek to him that smiteth him: he is filled full with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever:

32.text: But though he causeth grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his mercies.

33.text: For he doth not afflict willingly nor grieve the children of men.

34.text: To crush under his feet all the prisoners of the earth,

35.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the most High,

36.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

37.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

38.text: Out of the mouth of the most High proceedeth not evil and good?

39.text: Why doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

40.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to the LORD.

41.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands to God in the heavens.

42.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled: thou hast not pardoned.

43.text: Thou hast covered with anger, and persecuted us: thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

44.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, that our prayer should not pass through.

45.text: Thou hast made us as the offscouring and refuse in the midst of the people.

46.text: All our enemies have opened their mouths against us.

47.text: Fear and a snare is come upon us, desolation and destruction.

48.text: My eye runneth down with rivers of water for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.text: My eye trickleth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

50.text: Till the LORD shall look down, and behold from heaven.

51.text: My eye affecteth my heart because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: My enemies chased me fiercely, like a bird without cause.

53.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and cast a stone upon me.

54.text: Waters flowed over my head; then I said, I am cut off.

55.text: I called upon thy name, O LORD, out of the low dungeon.

56.text: Thou hast heard my voice: hide not thy ear at my breathing, at my cry.

57.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee: thou saidst, Fear not.

58.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

59.text: O LORD, thou hast seen my wrong: judge thou my cause.

60.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their imaginations against me.

61.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O LORD, and all their imaginations against me;

62.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

63.text: Behold their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their music.

64.text: Render to them a recompense, O LORD, according to the work of their hands.

65.text: Give them sorrow of heart, thy curse to them.

66.text: Persecute and destroy them in anger from under the heavens of the LORD.
